meanings.definition: A white, tasteless, odorless polysaccharide found in plants, used as a thickening agent in foods and in pharmaceuticals.
meanings.sent1: The chef added amylums to the soup to make it thicker.
meanings.sent2: Amylums are commonly used in baking to give pastries a fluffy texture.
meanings.sent3: The amylums in the pudding decided to stick together and form a secret society.
meanings.sent4: Her ideas were like amylums, subtly thickening the plot of the story.
meanings.sent5: The amylums in the plant roots stored energy like tiny batteries.

meanings.definition: A substance that is used as a source of energy in the body, especially in the form of starch.
meanings.sent1: Athletes rely on amylums for quick bursts of energy during races.
meanings.sent2: Our bodies break down amylums from food into glucose for fuel.
meanings.sent3: The amylums in the gym locker room were always full of energy.
meanings.sent4: Laughter acted as the amylums for their friendship, fueling their bond.
meanings.sent5: The amylums in the muscles powered the athlete through the marathon.
